intro: Phymatopsis engleri, commonly known as the Engler's phymatopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
